intro: Gymnosiphon panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian gymnosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Gymnosiphon panamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
